Hello,

I have a simple report containing just a chart, connected to a dataset from a mySQL database (see attachment chart.rptdesign).
Out of the Eclipse environment the report works well, in preview, in HTML and also in PDF.
If I deploy this report the the JBoss, and run it, I just get a blank page :-(

Here my configuration:

Java 1.4.2_06
JBoss AS 4.0.3SP1
BIRT 2.0.0

If I look into the BIRTs log I found a part with following error message:
...
SCHWERWIEGEND: Error happened while running the report.
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)
	at java.awt.GraphicsEnvironment.getLocalGraphicsEnvironment(GraphicsEnvironment.java:62)
...

I copied the mysql-connector-java-3.1.12-bin.jar into the birt/plugins/org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc/lib directory as well as into the JBoss/lib directory, but no success :-(

There is also another issue on that bug:

If run my report with run?... it just shows a blank page, no chart visible! Reports with tables (no charts) still work fine!
But if I run my report using frameset?... it shows an error message:

Exception in:
soapenv:Server.userException

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

(see also attachment birt.jpg and error_after_run.log)

Pelase help, its really urgent!

Thanks!

Hello, 

I found out more:

I completely reinstalled JBoss AS 4.0.3SP1.
I deployed my birt-viewer application, but without mysql-connector.x.x.x.jar.

I started my report, the result is attached as
error_chart.jpg.

So the chart shows only an image which is the first element of my report.
And it shows error messages, that it could not open the connection.
This is because it does not find the mysql-connector.x.x.x.jar.

Then I copied the mysql-connector.x.x.x.jar into the following directory:
birt-viewer/plugins/org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc/drivers 

Then I re-run the report and now it just shows this blank page in the browser.

Is there something I further have to do to make BIRT working with mySQL?
e.g. do I have to setup and deploy a mysql-ds.xml to JBoss or something like that?

Please help!

Can you try use the same data source and data set, but instead of creating a chart, create a simple table listing?  It helps us to isolate if the issue is data access or charting.

The log shows an out of memory error, did you try to increase the jvm heap size? Also is the chart shown on the screenshot an image you inserted in the report or the real chart? How could the chart render data if it couldn't access the database?

Hello Wenfeng Li,

I tested already, this behaviour happens only if the report contains a chart.
Reports just showing a table work fine!

Hello David,

I did'nt increase the jvm hepa size. how can I do it?
And sorry, the image in the screenshot is not a real chart! It is the header of my reports and just an image out of an imaging software.

You have to check the JBoss documentation for that. If you have access to the 
jvm command line , you can add -Xmx512M in it.
*** Bug 132551 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Probably needs to be run in headless mode : add this to the JVM command line 
(or as a system property): -Djava.awt.headless=true 

This could happen in the Linux environment did not define a display property, 
causing the exception shown in the log:

SCHWERWIEGEND: Error happened while running the report.
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)
	at 
java.awt.GraphicsEnvironment.getLocalGraphicsEnvironment(GraphicsEnvironment.java:62)
	at java.awt.image.BufferedImage.createGraphics(BufferedImage.java:1041)
	at java.awt.image.BufferedImage.getGraphics(BufferedImage.java:1031)
	at 
org.eclipse.birt.chart.device.swing.SwingDisplayServer.<init>(SwingDisplayServer.java:78)

This should solve the problem. So I mark it as resolved, you can reopen the bug 
if it doesn't fix it.

Hello David,

I found out exactly what you recommended.
It works if one sets the JVM to headless mode.

I set headleass mode in the run.sh of the JBoss and now it works fine!

Thanks!
